pr_title: Add more validations after yaml is serialized

timeline.message:
Add more validations after yaml is serialized

- Added validation for all our optional parameters
- Added new parameterized tests
- Found out yaml parses converts `null` to string if used as a map key

timeline.bodyText: value --> values and fix the description
timeline.author: chanseokoh

timeline.bodyText: IfExists sounds redundant to me when covering an empty collection. It doesn't cover null input though. I think checkNullOrNonNullEntries() coveys the intention more clearly, because it's difficult to know what "IfExists" means (== not null and collection is not empty") without reading the Javadoc. I initially thought "IfExists" means "if an entry exists at all." WDYT?
timeline.author: chanseokoh

replies.bodyText: yeah that makes sense to me, I was having trouble naming this.
replies.author: loosebazooka

timeline.bodyText: Nit: technically values.isEmpty() is unnecessary (the loop will fall through), but your preference.
timeline.author: chanseokoh

timeline.bodyText: I prefer Map.Entry<String, String> to avoid calling .get(key) (unnecessary map lookup operations).
timeline.author: chanseokoh
chanseokoh
chanseokoh
chanseokoh

timeline.bodyText: empty string key? I think "empty key" can be a bit ambiguous.
timeline.author: chanseokoh
chanseokoh

timeline.bodyText: Remove @Nullable? Or, does it cause some compilation trouble with NullAway?
timeline.author: chanseokoh

replies.bodyText: It technically accepts null values. Removing @Nullable would mean a check to use this method.?
replies.author: loosebazooka

replies.bodyText: Ah, I guess @Nullable makes sense as a check method.
replies.author: chanseokoh

timeline.bodyText: I think a user who purposely put an empty string to the property might be confused when they see this. "empty string"?
timeline.author: chanseokoh

timeline.bodyText: Remove @Nullable? Or, does it cause some compilation trouble with NullAway?
